intro: Anarrhinum incarnatum, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered with fine hairs, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Anarrhinum incarnatum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
